title: Thaicom picks Airbus to build Eutelsat-backed GEO satellite for Asia
summary: Thaicom has picked Airbus to deliver an Asia-focused spacecraft in 2027, putting the manufacturer ahead of the pack for geostationary communications satellite wins so far this year after leaving 2022 empty-handed.

title: NASA Leadership to Call Agency’s Record-Breaking Astronaut in Space
summary: During an Earth-to-Space call at 12:05 p.m. EDT Wednesday, Sept. 13, NASA Administrator Bill Nelson and Deputy Administrator Pam Melroy will speak with agency astronaut Frank Rubio about his record-breaking mission aboard the International Space Station.

title: Telesat signs multi-launch SpaceX deal covering all Lightspeed satellites
summary: Telesat has contracted 14 launches from SpaceX starting in mid-2026 to deploy its entire Lightspeed broadband constellation within a year, the Canadian satellite operator said Sept. 11.

title: Telesat Q&A | Getting back to Lightspeed
summary: SpaceNews interviewed Telesat CEO Dan Goldberg about the company's low Earth orbit roadmap after the operator secured financing to move forward with the Lightspeed project following years of delays.

title: Techstars welcomes 12 startups to 2023 Space Accelerator
summary: It’s Techstars’ first in-person Space Accelerator since its 2019 class, which included Orbit Fab, Pixxel, Zeno Power Systems, Morpheus Space, Hydrosat and Solestial.
